snippet: A new vaccine, previously thought to protect uninfected women who have infected partners, has now been found useless against herpes simplex virus-2 in a double-blinded placebo-controlled trial.
abstract: Study co-authored by Peter A Leone and published in The New England Journal of Medicine finds that latest vaccine, developed to protect uninfected women against both types of herpes simplex is useless against the HSV-2 virus, which causes genital herpes.
lead_paragraph: A new vaccine, previously thought to protect uninfected women who have infected partners, has now been found useless against herpes simplex virus-2 in a double-blinded placebo-controlled trial.

headline.seo: Herpes Vaccine Falls Short in Clinical Trial
headline.main: Herpes Vaccine Falls Short in Clinical Trial
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Herpes Vaccine Falls Short in Clinical Trial
